attributes.action: Fish Odour Syndrome (tmau) need help, need fund, need treatment
attributes.additional_details:
Fish Odour Syndrome- Trimethylaminuria is an uncommon genetic disorder that causes a strong body odour usually described as like rotting fish, faeces or garbage.

I have been bullied, humiliated, refused proper educational help due to my Fish Odour Syndrome (TMAU). Anytime now, I will be asked to leave my job due to not being hygienic. A diet so strict is not the answer for us sufferers. The antibiotics recommended by the health care profession only contributes to depression and vomiting. We need this disease to be recognised as a disability and we need proper funds for the research. No one deserves this kind of torture.

I need 100,000 signatures to be heard.

Does one need to take their life before their voice gets heard?

rejection.details:
This petition is being rejected for two reasons - it does not include a clear request for Government action and it does not satisfy the criteria for publication.

Please resubmit the petition stating clearly what action you want the Government to take.  You also need to include you full first name and your full last name before the petition can be published.
